learning_objective: Create computational models that represent the relationships among different elements of data collected from a phenomenon or process.
question_str:
{
    "Question": "Sky is doing a social science project on the concept of intersectionality. They want to use data of different individual attributes and see how they intersect to affect the individual's life. Which computational model using a coded snippet would best represent this?",
    "Answer1": "Creating an array for each attribute and performing operations on individual arrays.",
    "Answer2": "Using a dictionary with keys as attribute names and values as attribute effectiveness for each individual.",
    "Answer3": "Creating individual variables for each attribute and performing operations on individual variables.",
    "Answer4": "Creating a class for each individual and creating methods to operate on instance variables of each class.",
    "CorrectAnswer": "2",
    "Explanation": "A Dictionary best represents intersectionality because it can take multiple data types and can be designed to show how attributes (keys) intersect or how they affect individuals (values). Other options would have issues in showing the intersections or the relative effectiveness of different attributes.",
    "code_snippet": "class Person
 action Person()
  Dictionary <text,text> attributes = undefined
 end
 action setAttribute(text key, text value)
  attributes:Add(key, value)
 end
 action outputAttributes()
  text output = ""
  repeat through each key, value in attributes
   output = output + key + ": " + value + "\n"
  end
  output output
 end
end"
}
